info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 21 at 7:08PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN DE BACA AND NORTH CENTRAL CHAVES COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM MDT... At 708 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Mesa, or 37 miles north of Roswell, moving west at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Mesa. This includes Highway 285 between Mile Markers 139 and 164. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Motorists can expect brief but sudden changes in visibility and ponding of water on highways as storms move through the area.
